DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Within Clinical Study Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Total Bilirubin Measurement Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator related to the top value of the range for total bilirubin falling within parameters set forth by the guidelines for a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Within Clinical Study Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Total Bilirubin Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for total bilirubin, bilirubin is a breakdown product of hemoglobin and total bilirubin is measured to screen for or to monitor liver or gall bladder dysfunction, falling within parameters set forth by the action plan and guidelines for a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Within Clinical Study Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Total Bilirubin Measurement
Property.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:Bilirubin is a breakdown product of hemoglobin. Total and direct bilirubin are usually measured to screen for or to monitor liver or gall bladder dysfunction. (from MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia)

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x the upper limit of normal for the institution?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 X upper limit of normal (ULN) OR direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for patients with total bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre study serum bilirubin
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study serum bilirubin less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin within normal institutional limits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, with the exception of less than 2.9 mg/dL for patients with Gilbert's disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than 2 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the upper limit of normal for the institution?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR is direct bilirubin within normal range if pre-study total bilirubin greater than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 x the institutional upper limit normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than 2.5 x upper limit of normal if liver metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal, less than or equal 3.0 x upper limit of normal if due to Gilbert's syndrome or hemolysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilrubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal of patient has known Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome with slow conjugation of bilirubin is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin below institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or if patient has known Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome with slow conjugation of bilirubin is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, unless Gilbert's syndrome or disease infiltration of the liver is present?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL (except patients with Gilbert Syndrome, who can have total bilirubin less than 3.0 mg/dL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x local institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) OR if total bilirubin is elevated due Gilbert's disease or disease-related hemolysis then is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 x local institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study serum bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (with the exception of those with Gilbert syndrome)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, except for patients with Gilbert syndrome ALT less than or equal to 3.0 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (patients with Gilbert's syndrome may have serum bilirubin greater than 1.5 x upper limit of normal)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal if no demonstrable liver metastases or less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal in the presence of liver metastases or Gilbert's Syndrome (unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled), within 2 weeks of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL unless due to Gilbert's syndrome, hemolysis, or ineffective hematopoiesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, except for patients with Gilbert syndrome; ALT less than or equal to 3.0 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or if patient has known Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome with slow conjugation of bilirubin is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to the institution's upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (patients with Gilbert's syndrome may have direct bilirubin more than 1.5 x upper limit of normal)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (less than 2.0 x ULN for subjects with documented Gilbert's syndrome or less than  3.0 x ULN for subjects for whom the indirect bilirubin level suggests an extra-hepatic source of elevation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal if no demonstrable liver metastases or less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal in the presence of liver metastases or Gilbert's Syndrome (unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (except patients with Gilberts syndrome who can have total bilirubin less than 3 mg/dl)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, except for patients with Gilbert syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than or equal to upper limit of normal (ULN) OR direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for patients with total bilirubin levels greater than ULN; (except patients with Gilbert's Syndrome, who must have a total bilirubin less than 3.0 mg/dL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin within normal limits (WNL) or less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN in patients with liver metastases; or total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 x ULN with direct bilirubin WNL in patients with documented Gilbert's Syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (less than 2.0 x ULN for patients with documented Gilbert's syndrome or less than  3.0 x ULN for subjects for whom the indirect bilirubin level suggests an extra-hepatic source of elevation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (except patients with Gilberts syndrome who can have total bilirubin less than 3 mg/dl)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than 2.5 x upper limit of normal if patient is know to have liver metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (less than 2.0 x ULN for subjects with documented Gilbert's syndrome or less than 3.0 x ULN for subjects for whom the indirect bilirubin levels suggests an extrahepatic source of elevation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR greater than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal is allowed if direct bilirubin is within normal range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled), within 2 weeks of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (except patients with Gilbert's syndrome who can have total bilirubin less than 3 mg/dl)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than 2.5 x upper limit of normal if patient is know to have liver metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin within normal institutional limits OR if patient has confirmed Gilbert's syndrome is total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL (except patients with Gilbert Syndrome, who can have total bilirubin less than 3.0 mg/dL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, unless due to Gilbert syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin within normal institutional limits (WLN) or less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) in patients with liver metastases; or total bilirubin less than or equal to 3 x ULN with direct bilirubin WLN in patients with well documented Gilbert's syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -  53
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 2.0 unless due to Gilbert's Syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) (or if patient has known Gilbert disease is serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 55
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 2.0 mg/dL unless due to Gilbert's Syndrome then less than 5.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 54
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 65
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to the upper limit of normal (except in Gilbert's syndrome)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 57
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than institutional upper limit of normal or less than 3X the upper limit of normal in patients with Gilbert's disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 66
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless the subject has known or suspected Gilbert's syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 56
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 61
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin within institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 63
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than to 2 x upper limit of normal (patients with Gilbert's syndrome may have direct bilirubin more than 2.5 x upper limit of normal)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 58
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin below or within normal institutional limits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 64
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal for patients with Gilbert syndrome), within 7 days before starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 62
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) (or if patient has documented Gilbert's disease is total bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 mg/dL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 60
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than upper limit (ULN) of normal or less than 1.5 x  upper limit of normal (ULN) in patients with liver metastases or total bilirubin less than 3.0 x upper limit of normal (ULN) with direct bilirubin within normal limits (WNL) in patients with well documented Gilbert's Syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 59
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 3.0 mg/dL if patient has Gilbert's disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 67
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal or less than 3.0 mg/dL if patient has Gilbert's disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 68
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is screening visit total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert`s disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 x ULN may be enrolled)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 70
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (except patients with Gilberts syndrome who can have total bilirubin less than 3 mg/dl)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 71
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 2 times the upper limit of institutional normal (ULN) unless due to Gilbert's disease or thought to be related to the underlying disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 69
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than 2 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 72
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) except for patients with Gilbert's syndrome or post-transfusion hemolysis who may enroll if direct bilirubin is less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN of the direct bilirubin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 73
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 75
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the upper limit of normal (ULN) for the institution?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 78
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient does not have Gilbert syndrome, is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 77
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) except for patients with Gilbert's syndrome hemolysis who may enroll if direct bilirubin is less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for the laboratory of the direct bilirubin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 79
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN), except for patients with Gilbert's syndrome who may enroll if direct bilirubin is less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for the laboratory?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 80
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 74
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study bilirubin less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) except for patients with Gilbert's syndrome who may enroll if direct bilirubin is less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 76
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN (less than 3 x ULN for patients with Gilbert syndrome, patients with cholestasis due to compressive adenopathies of the hepatic hilum or documented liver involvement)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 88
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (less than or equal to 3.0 x upper limit of normal for patients with Gilbert syndrome)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 84
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or direct bilirubin less than or equal to upper limit of normal for patients with total bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 82
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal or less than 3X the upper limit of normal for indirect bilirubin in patients with Gilbert's disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 83
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study total bilirubin and serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 85
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 86
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 2.0 mg/dL unless due to Gilbert's Syndrome then less than 5.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 87
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or up to 3 mg/dL for patients with Gilberts disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 90
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1 x the institutional upper limit of normal except for patients with Gilbert's syndrome who may enroll if direct bilirubin is less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 91
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (for patients with hemolysis, Gilbert's syndrome or liver infiltration with leukemia is serum bilirubin less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 92
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 X upper limit of normal (ULN) OR direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for patients with total bilirubin levels greater than 1.5  x ULN or serum bilirubin less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal for patients with known Gilberts disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 89
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal, except for patients with Gilbert syndrome who have less than or equal to 3 x the institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 96
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 X upper limit of normal (ULN); or less than 3 x institutional ULN for Gilbert's syndrome or HIV protease inhibitors; or less than 5 x ULN and direct bilirubin less than 0.7 mg/dL for patients on atazanavir containing HIV regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 95
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 X upper limit of normal (ULN) OR direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for patients with total bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 94
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal, for age?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 81
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal (less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal in the presence of documented Gilbert's syndrome or liver metastases at baseline), within 8 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 97
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless the patient has Gilberts disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 101
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 X upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 98
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin within normal limits (WNL) or less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN in patients with liver metastases, or is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3 X ULN with direct bilirubin WNL in patients with well-documented Gilbert's Syndrome (within 7 days of study drug initiation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 102
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2 x the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 103
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2 mg/dl, unless from hemolysis, Gilbert's syndrome or liver infiltration with leukemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 104
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 3 x the institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 93
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the upper limit of normal or direct bilirubin less than or equal to upper limit of normal for subjects with total bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 105
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)  OR serum bilirubin less than or equal to 3x ULN for patients with known Gilbert disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 107
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) except for subjects with Gilbert's syndrome or genetic equivalent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 109
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) except subjects with known Gilbert's syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 114
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal if no liver metastases or less than 3 x ULN if patient has Gilbert's Syndrome or liver metastases at baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 115
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x institutional ULN if patient has history of Gilbert's  syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 111
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) and less than 3 x ULN in the presence of documented Gilbert's syndrome or liver metastases at baseline within 14 days of randomization/enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 112
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 113
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal for patient age with the exception of those with Gilbert syndrome within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 110
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) for age unless due to Gilbertâ€™s syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 117
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) unless due to leukemic infiltration, Gilbert's Syndrome, or hemolysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 108
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN); If total bilirubin is greater than 1.5 x ULN, is direct bilirubin less than ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 116
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) except for participants with Gilbert's syndrome or in whom the elevated bilirubinemia is due to ART (must be grade less than or equal to 2)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 118
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) OR less than 3 x institutional ULN for patients with Gilbert's syndrome or HIV protease inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 119
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) for age (sum of conjugated and unconjugated)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 120
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study direct bilirubin less than or equal to 2 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 122
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal OR less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal in the presence of documented Gilbert's syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 123
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (less than 3 x upper limit of reference range in patients with known/suspected Gilbert's disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 121
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5xULN (institutional upper limit of normal) OR Direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for subjects with total bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 125
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal (less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal in the presence of documented Gilbert's syndrome or liver metastases at baseline)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 99
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the upper limit of normal OR direct bilirubin less than or equal to the upper limit of normal for patients with total bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 x the upper limit of normal, within 3 days prior to the first day of 7+3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 124
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) OR less than 2.0 x ULN in patients with documented Gilbert's Syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 128
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN), (less than 3 x ULN in the presence of documented Gilbert's syndrome or liver metastases at baseline), within 14 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 127
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal (less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal in the presence of documented Gilbert's syndrome)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 129
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) for age OR total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 times ULN and direct bilirubin within normal limits for patients with Gilberts syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 126
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum bilirubin within normal institutional limits (0 - 1.2 mg/dl)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 130
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institution's upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 131
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN); If total bilirubin is greater than 1.5 x ULN, is direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 132
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin within 2 weeks of enrollment less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 133
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (or less than or equal to 2.0 x ULN in patients with documented Gilbert's Syndrome)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -134
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal unless due to Gilbert's disease, hemolysis, or lymphomatous involvement of liver?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 135
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - Corrected 134
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) within 14 days prior to study registration, however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level greater than or equal to 3 x ULN may be enrolled?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 136
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal unless due to Gilbert's disease, hemolysis, or lymphomatous involvement of liver, in which case total bilirubin should be less than or equal to 5 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 137
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 138
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN), except if elevated bilirubin is due to Gilberts disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 139
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 140
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN), unless considered due to Gilberts disease or disease involvement following approval by the Medical Monitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 141
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 2 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN), except for patients with Gilbertâ€™s syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 142
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 143
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (with the exception of patients with Gilbert syndrome who have a high baseline bilirubin)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 144
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL (excluding Gilberts disease)?
